#Text=77 names added to fallen journalist memorial in Washington , D.C.
#Text=Tuesday , March 31 , 2009
#Text=The names of 77 reporters , photographers and broadcasters were added to a memorial to honor slain journalists in the Newseum in Washington , D.C. .

#Text=" These 77 individuals were brought together in a fellowship that none of them would have chosen , a fellowship created by their commitment , their courage and , ultimately , their sacrifice , " said Chris Wells , vice president of the Freedom Forum , which runs the Newseum .
#Text=The Newseum Journalist 's Memorial contains the names of 1,913 journalists dating back to 1837 .
#Text=Thirteen of the names added Monday were journalists killed in Iraq in 2008 , which has been the most dangerous country for journalists since the Iraq War began in 2003 .
#Text=Mexico was the second deadliest country for journalists last year , with five journalists being killed due to drug violence .
#Text=According to Newseum records , Mexico had not been so dangerous for journalists in at least five years .
#Text=Among the slain journalists in Mexico was Armando Rodriguez , a reporter who covered crime along the border of El Paso , Texas , for 10 years .
#Text=He was shot to death in his driveway while sitting in his car with his eight-year-old daughter .
#Text=" These murders strike at the heart of democracy by silencing speech and by depriving a community of the information it needs to conduct its affairs , " said Newseum chairman Alberto Ibarguen .
#Text=The Newseum , a journalism museum in Washington , D.C. .
#Text=Another was Magomed Yevloyev , who ran the independent Russian news site Ingushetia.org , which the Russian government tried to shut down .
#Text=Yevloyev was shot while in police custody ; authorities said he tried to take an officer 's weapon .
#Text=Some of the journalists added to the memorial were killed in accidents , rather than murders or war zones .
#Text=Tom Borrelli , a sports writer for The Buffalo News , died after falling down a set of metal stairs at a high school football stadium and landing on his head .
#Text=" I hate more than anything that it had to come to this , but it did come to this , " said Borelli 's widow , Karen .
#Text="
